Today, I’m leading a hearing to tackle one of the biggest obstacles for rural broadband: poor data and mapping. 

We'll hear from broadband experts doing the real work on the ground, including UniTel's Beth Osler from Unity. 
Follow along here >>> 
 https://youtu.be/8D7i8AUbhMk

We’ll be voting shortly on the amendment to try and attach it to the final appropriations bill. My staff and I have spent the day educating other members of Congress about this issue and trying to build support. Stay tuned. #mepolitics
Despite pressure from these special interests, I remain unmoved. All we’re asking for is policymaking based on reliable, peer reviewed science and data pic.twitter.com/29s0o6zRPF

Unfortunately, since we introduced our amendment, we’ve seen powerful special interest groups actively try to kill the legislation. They’re telling members I don’t care about right whales. The truth is I want the whales to recover, but I want to use sound science & data to do it. pic.twitter.com/DZf1m0VYNN
.@ChelliePingree has been a leader for Maine fisheries for years. She also believes NOAA’s tool is broken https://twitter.com/chelliepingree/status/1141753428147879937 …
What’s so wrong with the process NOAA used to make these regulations? The very data tool they used to create the rules is riddled with flaws. Here are just a few: pic.twitter.com/oUTMxXXGjX

Lobstermen support entire communities in my state — Stonington, Jonesport, Cranberry Isles, and many more. It’s not right for NOAA to rush ahead with misguided regulations that threaten the way of life for these communities. This kind of thing is all too common in Washington. pic.twitter.com/rfubHSOjgO

I spoke on the floor this morning to lay out the case for freezing NOAA’s regulations on lobstermen until they put their data tool through peer review. We should work to protect right whales, but we have to do it with sound science and data. #mepolitics
Thanks to @ChelliePingree for joining me to sponsor this amendment.

My amendment is pretty simple. It blocks NOAA from enforcing the new regulations until NOAA's data tool goes through a scientific peer review. 

This is a basic step for good policy-making, but NOAA blew by it. Sound science and good data shouldn’t be too much to expect. 3/

I've introduced an amendment that would block the new regulations so that NOAA's data tool can go through review. 2/

Read more here: 
 https://golden.house.gov/media/press-releases/golden-introduces-amendment-block-regulations-maine-lobstermen-demands-rigorous … pic.twitter.com/JIsqao5xxV

NOAA's new regulations ask Maine lobstermen to make huge sacrifices without proof that the regulations will actually work or that Maine lobstermen are the source of the problem. #mepolitics

It's time to take a stand 1/

I helped secure provisions in the bill to:
- Ensure a new Arleigh Burke-class destroyer is #BathBuiltBestBuilt
- Develop a plan to grow & train the shipbuilding workforce
- Clean up dangerous PFAS chemicals at Bangor Air Nat'l Guard Base
- & much more: 2/ https://golden.house.gov/media/press-releases/golden-secures-maine-priorities-defense-funding-bill …

Last week, I worked w/ the Armed Services Committee to make sure this year's defense funding bill makes smart investments to protect our county. Through 21 straight hrs of debate & voting, we hammered out a bill that delivers for Maine, our shipbuilders, & our nat'l security. 1/ pic.twitter.com/1IOTtWEAw6

I also had a good discussion with New Balance workers about being a veteran on the Armed Services Committee, trade issues, and what qualities I looked for in a boot when I was a Marine infantryman. 2/ pic.twitter.com/2g7ldCrznZ

Thanks to the skilled workers at New Balance for the quality product they provide to our Marines and Navy.  I’m proud we make these shoes right here in Maine.

It was great to meet these workers in Norridgewock last week & learn about the process behind these Maine-made shoes. 1/ pic.twitter.com/mpH43glQnA

At the Bangor Vets Center, I learned more about the work they're doing to provide child care to Maine veterans. Too often, vets have to choose between mental health care they need & taking care of their kids. Bangor Vets Center does critical work to address this issue for ME vets pic.twitter.com/6PNfp2Akcm

I had the honor of opening the @SpecialOMaine games at @UMaine last week. These athletes are incredibly inspiring and I’m glad I was able to join them for their 50th anniversary. pic.twitter.com/SnfyOf68mw

That’s why I included a provision in the defense funding bill to direct the Navy to develop a plan to grow & train our shipbuilding workforce to meet nat'l security needs and provide high quality, skilled, & stable jobs to Mainers in the coming decades. 2/

The @USNavy plans to expand its fleet to 355 ships in the next 30 years. We need to be sure shipyards are prepared to build those ships and I want to know what we need to do to train and prepare Mainers to get those shipbuilding jobs. 1/

These are hardworking people, but there are limits to what America can ask them to take on. The president provided tariff relief to farmers. He should offer the same relief directly to lobstermen hurt by tariffs & direct NOAA to work with lobstermen toward reasonable solutions 3/ pic.twitter.com/gEfZ8Hn87f
Maine lobstermen are being squeezed right now. Bait shortages & other factors are driving up operating costs. Lobstermen are staring down the barrel of harsh, misguided regulations from NOAA. 2/
